channel.title: My eportfolio and forums
channel.description:
Please note that I haven't actually started advertising this website yet. So that's why I have 1 user on the forums, (Me, lul.). I may delete the forum anyway as I don't think I'll be able to get any members.
Anyway the website is; [url=http://thesteven.net/]http://thesteven.net/[/url]
EDIT: Ohshit, I forgot to ask what I wanted you to do, LOL. Could you please provide feedback on this site, what's good and what's bad, etc.
Thanks.

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

I’ll download Chrome now. Firefox does have an Inspect Element option in the addon, firebug.
And ah, I see, some of the links in the nav are outside of the #nav div.

There, I think I fixed them all.

Read full topic

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:


The blue-purplish part enclosed by the black border is #nav.
Have you got Opera or Chrome? Not sure if Firefox has it, but try inspecting the elements, there’s several occasions where the div doesn’t fill up the space you would expect it to fill.

Read full topic

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Heh. Thanks, but I’m not quite sure what you mean by “the menu items in the nav bar are sticking out of #nav”. Could you explain this a bit more please?

Read full topic

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Courier New eh?
Interesting choice, I rarely see sites using it.

Do you have a browser such as Opera or Chrome, which have an Inspect Element option?
If so, play around with it. The way you’ve laid it out looks rather funny to me.
For example, the menu items in the nav bar are sticking out of #nav (the div doesn’t span it’s full height)

Also, if you’re looking for a way to make the footer stick to the bottom, try this

Read full topic

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

I had a look here; http://www.ahfx.net/weblog/22 - There seems to be very few fonts that are on all systems.
These seem to be the “Browser Safe Fonts”. I chose Courier New it then goes to Arial and then finally sans-serif.

I’ve also changed the background to a more lavendar colour and I’ve also removed the navigation from the sidebar and added a 1 px border to the left side of the main content section.

Read full topic

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Well, the problem with picking a font is that not everyone has the same fonts installed, and not every browser supports the css font loading thing.
You could go with the classics, Helvetica or Arial, or you could try a chart like this, but the risk is that a user might not have the font you picked.

Read full topic

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Thanks for your feedback. I’ll be sure to look at that website.

Could you suggest some Fonts that’s better to use then Serif fonts? Maybe I could just add a 1px border on the right side of the navigation sidebar to seperate it from the main content, I’ll see how it looks.

Read full topic

item.title: My eportfolio and forums
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Doesn’t look too bad, but I’ve got a few comments:

  1. Why the double navigation? Surely a navbar or menu should be sufficient.

  2. The font. While it may be a design decision you made, I personally dislike using Serif fonts in websites, and that brings me to 3)

  3. In your css, you set the font to Georgia, which is a Serif font, yet as fallback you’ve put down sans-serif, why?

  4. I don’t really feel like I’m being pulled towards the content. It might help to darken out some places slightly, so there’s more emphasis on the content. There’s also no seperation between the menu bar and the content, maybe that’ll fix it.

  5. Spaces around the buttons in the navbar. I think it’s a bit overdoing

Other than that it looks fine. It’s a bit bland, but not bad. The source looks neat.
If you’re having trouble picking colors, head over to ColourLovers, where you can easily find palettes of colors which work well together.

Read full topic
